page.title: 13Shouldham-A day at school.2
page.content: In class maths this week we have been looking at different types of graphs; drawing some and making up questions we could ask the rest of the class. This usually lasts for 20 minutes and then we do our individual card maths. Each person works at their own speed through eight sets of cards. When they have finished a set they have to do a test before they can carry on to the next set. Mr. Swift marks the test with us at dinner time and we tell the rest of the class how many marks we have got. If we don't do very well we have to do extra work before moving on to the next set. We have playtime about 10.35, but just before play we often say our multiplication tables. Playtime is noisy. Some people stand talking,eating their crisps,apples or carrots,whilst others are busy playing with ropes,toys or at hide and seek.
